result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L Marchel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:34 AM Defendant Joshua L Marchel not in court.  Attorney Anne Renc appeared by video for Joshua L Marchel.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CM3, 22CF37 and 22CF145.

Defendant is in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.
ADA Cassidy states that arrangements had been made by her office for him to appear via ZOOM from the Waupaca County Jail. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.

Court states that the status conference was set more to make sure that the competency evaluation was being completed.
Meeting is set for 11/01/22 and the report should be filed by 11/15/22.
Court questions Atty Renc if she wishes to make a record; she does not.
Court questions if she has been in contact with her client.
She responds and states that the she has not been in contact with him.
Atty Renc will need to make time to go over to the Waupaca County Jail.
Court set this to make sure that these cases continued to move forward.
Court questions the parties if they wish to set a hearing.
Atty Renc would ask for 12/05/22 at about 11 a.m.
Court questions Atty Renc what she would like to set this for and she indicates it all depends on what the evaluation states.
ADA Cassidy makes statements.
Atty Renc informs the parties that this is for NGI and not competency

BY THE COURT: 
Status Conference to be set for 12/05/22 
If parties wish to set for an additional hearing they will need to get in contact with the Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Order for Examination Under 971.16 Wis Stats /s/ PB 10/17/22
sent to WFU/BC & WCS on 10/18/22 sp

Defendant Joshua L Marchel appeared by video.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Joshua L Marchel.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-37, 22CF-145 and 22CM-3. 

10:31 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

This was set for a status today.
Court wanted to make sure things were on track to get a report.
Court reviews the files.

An order was filed but a report wasn't been filed.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear. 
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.

Evaluation is not completed.
Judicial Assistant was asked to contact behavioral consultants.
State makes no record.
Atty Renc states that Defendant has been in custody since March 14th of 2022.

Court will set matters for another status.
Court is not sure why the form was not filled out.
Another order will be prepared and have the process expedited.

No victim rights need to be addressed today.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Notice of Hearing 10/17/22 at 10:30AM - Return to sender attempted not known unable to forward
Order for Examination under 971.16, Wis Stats (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) /s/ PB 08/31/22

11:49 AM Defendant Joshua L Marchel in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Joshua L Marchel.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-37, 22CF-145 and 22CM-3.

Court calls cases. 
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Today Defendant will be amending his pleas on all these matters.

Atty Renc requests that the pleas be amended to not guilty and not guilty by reason of defect or disease. 

Court questions Defendant if he understands the process today.
Defendant thinks he understands and has had time to talk with Atty Renc. 

Defendant enters pleas of :
22CF-37 Count 1: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
22CF-37 Count 2: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
22CF-145 Count 1: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
22CF-145: Count 2: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
22CF-145: Count 3: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
22CF-145: Count 4: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
22CM-3: Count 1: Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.

Court signs proposed orders for NGI evaluation.

Defendant is currently on a cash bond.
Court's office will contact Behavioral Consultants.

971.16(3) is referred to.

Cases will be set for a status conference. 

State has complied with victim notification statutes. 
There are no victims present for today's purposes. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Proposed Order for NGI Evaluation 22CM3
filed by the State
Plea Hearing set for 08/30/22 - attempted, not known
Matter set for a Plea Hearing on 08/30/2022 at 11:00 a.m.  - Defendant to change plea from not guilty to NGI on all open cases
Plea hearing on August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender Refused
/s/LJM 6-22-2022 - Approved - Judge Baker.

sent to WFU/BC on 10/18/22 sp
No contact with I.C.H.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of  Misdemeanor Theft. 
Atty Renc states the defendant is eligible for public defender representation. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  01/24/2022  @ 2:00  p.m.  in Branch 1
